Cachecade.longDescription: This attribute represents the cachecade state of the virtual disk. It can be modified to create a cachecaded virtual disk using XML configuration feature. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
Cachecade.name: Cachecade

CurrentControllerMode.longDescription: This indicates controllers current personaility mode , which could be RAID or Non-RAID.
CurrentControllerMode.name: CurrentControllerMode

DiskCachePolicy.longDescription: Set the physical disk caching policy of all members of a Virtual Disk by enabling the Disk Cache Policy. When this feature is enabled, the physical disk writes data to the physical disk cache before writing it to the physical disk. Because it is faster to write data to the cache than to a disk, enabling this feature can improve system performance.
DiskCachePolicy.name: DiskCachePolicy

EncryptionMode.longDescription: This attribute represents encryption mode on the controller. It could be used to set the encryption mode to Local Key Management or Dell Key Management on the controller through XML configuration feature.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
EncryptionMode.name: EncryptionMode

IncludedPhysicalDiskID.longDescription: This is a pseudo attribute for XML configuration feature. It is used for specifying physical disk FQDD for creating a virtual disk. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
IncludedPhysicalDiskID.name: IncludedPhysicalDiskID

KeyID.longDescription: This attribute represents the controller key identifier for Local Key Management or Dell Key Management controller encryption modes. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
KeyID.name: KeyID

LockStatus.longDescription: This attribute represents security status of the virtual disk. It is used to secure a virtual disk using XML configuration feature. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
LockStatus.name: LockStatus

Name.longDescription: Diplays the name associated with a Virtual Disk.
Name.name: Name

NewControllerKey.longDescription: This attribute represents the controller passphrase for Local Key Management encryption mode. This is used during a ReKey operation to specify the new controller key. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
NewControllerKey.name: NewControllerKey

OldControllerKey.longDescription: This attribute represents the controller passphrase for Local Key Management encryption mode. This is used during a ReKey operation to specify the old controller key. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
OldControllerKey.name: OldControllerKey

PCIeSSDSecureErase.longDescription: Performs full initialization on the selected physical device. This operation deletes all data on the device.
PCIeSSDSecureErase.name: PCIeSSDSecureErase

RAIDAssetTag.longDescription: Displays the Asset Tag information for the enclosure.
RAIDAssetTag.name: RAIDAssetTag

RAIDControllerBootMode.longDescription: This indicates the current BootMode setting of the Controller. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDControllerBootMode.name: RAIDControllerBootMode

RAIDEffectiveSASAddress.longDescription: This attribute represents the effective SAS Address of an enclosure.
RAIDEffectiveSASAddress.name: RAIDEffectiveSASAddress

RAIDEnclosureCurrentCfgMode.longDescription: This indicates enclosures current configuration mode setting
RAIDEnclosureCurrentCfgMode.name: RAIDEnclosureCurrentCfgMode

RAIDEnclosureRequestedCfgMode.longDescription: This indicates enclosures requested configuration mode setting.
RAIDEnclosureRequestedCfgMode.name: RAIDEnclosureRequestedCfgMode

RAIDEnhancedAutoImportForeignConfig.longDescription: This indicates the current EnhancedAutoImportForeignConfig setting of the controller. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDEnhancedAutoImportForeignConfig.name: RAIDEnhancedAutoImportForeignConfig

RAIDHotSpareStatus.longDescription: On RAID controllers, a hot spare is a backup for a disk that fails. The attribute indicates whether a physical disk is Hot Spare and/or the type of hot spare.Configurable via XML configuration only.
RAIDHotSpareStatus.name: RAIDHotSpareStatus

RAIDMaxCapableSpeed.longDescription: This attribute represents the maximum link speed supported by the controller.
RAIDMaxCapableSpeed.name: RAIDMaxCapableSpeed

RAIDNegotiatedSpeed.longDescription: Negotiated Speed shows the speed of data transfer that the disk negotiated while spinning up and upon initial communication with the controller. This speed is dependent on the speed of the disk, the capable speed of the controller, the current speed of the controller on that connector, and the speed of the EMM (Enclosure Management Module) on the enclosure.
RAIDNegotiatedSpeed.name: RAIDNegotiatedSpeed

RAIDNominalMediumRotationRate.longDescription: This attribute represents the nominal medium rotation speed of a physical disk.
RAIDNominalMediumRotationRate.name: RAIDNominalMediumRotationRate

RAIDPDState.longDescription: Physical Disk State shows the state of Physical disk that is part of a Virtual Disk.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDPDState.name: RAIDPDState

RAIDSupportedRAIDLevels.longDescription: This attribute provides a list of RAID levels supported by the controller.
RAIDSupportedRAIDLevels.name: RAIDSupportedRAIDLevels

RAIDTypes.longDescription: This indicates the type of RAID level on the virtual disk. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDTypes.name: RAIDTypes

RAIDaction.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents RAID action to be performed on the virtual disk. It is used to specify Delete, Create , CreateAuto or Update virtual disk operations. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDaction.name: RAIDaction

RAIDbatteryLearnMode.longDescription: Battery Learn Mode controls a RAID Controller's Battery Learn Cycle.
RAIDbatteryLearnMode.name: RAIDbatteryLearnMode

RAIDbgiRate.longDescription: The Background Initialization (BGI) rate is the percentage of the system's resources dedicated to performing the background initialization of a virtual disk after it is created
RAIDbgiRate.name: RAIDbgiRate

RAIDccMode.longDescription: Check Consistency feature is used to verify the accuracy of the redundant (parity) information.
RAIDccMode.name: RAIDccMode

RAIDccRate.longDescription: The Check Consistency rate is the percentage of the system's resources dedicated to performing a check consistency on a redundant virtual disk.
RAIDccRate.name: RAIDccRate

RAIDcopybackMode.longDescription: This attribute represents the mode of restoring configuration of a virtual disk when a failed physical disk is replaced in an array.
RAIDcopybackMode.name: RAIDcopybackMode

RAIDdedicatedSpare.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents the dedicated spare to be assigned to a virtual disk. It could be set to physical disk FQDD to be assigned as a dedicated spare to the virtual disk. If a Spare is intended to be assigned when  RAIDaction is set as CreateAuto, this attribute value should be set to AutoSelect. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDdedicatedSpare.name: RAIDdedicatedSpare

RAIDdefaultReadPolicy.longDescription: The read policies indicate whether or not the controller should read sequential sectors of the virtual disk when seeking data.
RAIDdefaultReadPolicy.name: RAIDdefaultReadPolicy

RAIDdefaultWritePolicy.longDescription: The write policies specify whether the controller sends a write-request completion signal as soon as the data is in the cache or after it has been written to disk.
RAIDdefaultWritePolicy.name: RAIDdefaultWritePolicy

RAIDforeignConfig.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents foreign configuration operation to be performed on the RAID controller via XML configuration feature.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDforeignConfig.name: RAIDforeignConfig

RAIDinitOperation.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents initialization configuration operation to be performed on the virtual disk via XML configuration feature. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDinitOperation.name: RAIDinitOperation

RAIDloadBalancedMode.longDescription: This attribute reprsents the ability to automatically use both controller ports connected to the same enclosure to route I/O requests.
RAIDloadBalancedMode.name: RAIDloadBalancedMode

RAIDmaxPDsInSpan.longDescription: This attribute represents the maximum number of Physical Disks in a single Span, as supported by the controller.
RAIDmaxPDsInSpan.name: RAIDmaxPDsInSpan

RAIDmaxSpansInVD.longDescription: This attribute represents the maximum number of spans in a Virtual Disk, as supported by the controller.
RAIDmaxSpansInVD.name: RAIDmaxSpansInVD

RAIDmaxSupportedVD.longDescription: This attribute represents the maximum number of virtual disks supported by the controller.
RAIDmaxSupportedVD.name: RAIDmaxSupportedVD

RAIDprMode.longDescription: Patrol Read is a feature for identifying disk errors in order to avoid disk failures and data loss or corruption. The Patrol Read only runs on disks that are being used in a virtual disk or that are hot spares.
RAIDprMode.name: RAIDprMode

RAIDprRate.longDescription: The Patrol Read Rate is the percentage of the system's resources dedicated to perform Patrol Read.
RAIDprRate.name: RAIDprRate

RAIDrebuildRate.longDescription: The Rebuild Rate is the percentage of the system's resources dedicated to rebuilding a failed disk when a rebuild is necessary.
RAIDrebuildRate.name: RAIDrebuildRate

RAIDreconstructRate.longDescription: The Reconstruct Rate is the percentage of the system's resources dedicated to reconstructing a disk group after adding a physical disk or changing the RAID level of a virtual disk residing on the disk group
RAIDreconstructRate.name: RAIDreconstructRate

RAIDrekey.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents whether a rekey operation needs to be performed on the RAID controller.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDrekey.name: RAIDrekey

RAIDremovecontrollerKey.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents whether a rekey operation needs to be performed on the RAID controller.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDremovecontrollerKey.name: RAIDremovecontrollerKey

RAIDresetConfig.longDescription: This pseudo attribute represents whether a reset config operation needs to be performed on the RAID controller.Reset Config operation deletes all the virtual disks that exists on the RAID controller. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
RAIDresetConfig.name: RAIDresetConfig

RAIDspinDownIdleTime.longDescription: Spindown idle time is the amount of time in seconds an uncofigured or hotspare can be idle before being spinned down by the controller.
RAIDspinDownIdleTime.name: RAIDspinDownIdleTime

RAIDsupportedDiskProt.longDescription: This attribute provides a list of Disk Protocols supported by the controller.
RAIDsupportedDiskProt.name: RAIDsupportedDiskProt

Size.longDescription: This indicates the size in bytes of the virtual disk. When creating a virtual disk, size of 0 indicates using full size of the physical disks for the specified RAIDTypes.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
Size.name: Size

SpanDepth.longDescription: This indicates number of spans in the virtual disk.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
SpanDepth.name: SpanDepth

SpanLength.longDescription: This indicates the number of physical disks per span on a virtual disk.Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
SpanLength.name: SpanLength

StripeSize.longDescription: This indicates the stripe size of the virtual disk. Configurable via XML configuration feature only.
StripeSize.name: StripeSize
